problem: A right rectangular pyramid with a square base of side 6 and a height of 8 is cut by a plane parallel to its base at a height of 4. Find the volume of the smaller pyramid formed at the top.
solution: The smaller pyramid is similar to the original pyramid with a ratio of their heights, which is 1:2. Thus, the volume ratio is 1:8 (since volume scales with the cube of the linear dimensions). The volume of the original pyramid is $(1/3)\times \text{base area} \times \text{height} = (1/3)\times 6^2\times 8 = 96$. Therefore, the volume of the smaller pyramid is $96/8 = 12$ cubic units. \(\boxed{12}\)
